member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.Barcode2DCells.Dots
member.remarks:
Usable with IRtcMoF.
Not usable with IRtcAutoLaserControl, IRtcWobbel or IRtcSkywriting.
Activated LASER ON signal during rastering and modulated output pulse width by each pixels time.
Pixel pulses (at the LASER1 port) directly by the PulseLength parameter, not the LASERON signal.
Rtc6SyncAxis is not supported Dots cell type. Because Rtc6SyncAxis is not supported IRtcRaster interface.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.HatchModes.Polygon
member.remarks:
Used with HatchJoints, internal values.
Adjust Config.DivideArcToLinesDistance value to reduce vertices at arc path.
Must be aware winding direction are same within polylines.
This hatch type leads to CPU burst. so need to consider optimized calls.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.HatchJoints.Square
member.remarks: Squaring is applied uniformally at all convex edge joins.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.HatchJoints.Round
member.remarks: While flattened paths can never perfectly trace an arc, they are approximated by a series of arc chords.

member.name: F:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.HatchJoints.Miter
member.remarks: For any given edge join, when miter offsetting would exceed that maximum distance, 'square' joining is applied.

member.remarks:

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.ITextConvertible
member.remarks:
TextConvertible means, possible to change(or convert) source text data into converted data.
Support text data at entity (like as barcode or text) can be converted format by event handler.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.ITextConvertible.IsConvertedText
member.remarks:
To convert source(or input) text by user, should be add Config.OnTextConvert event handler at first.
Config.OnTextConvert event would be fired before do mark by IMarkerable.Mark at IMarker.
Used with EntityCircularText, EntityImageText, EntityDataMatrix, EntityQRCode, EntityPDF417 entities.
Used with EntityText, EntitySiriusText also if CharacterSetFormats.Normal has configured.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.ITextConvertible.SourceText
member.remarks:
If IsConvertedText is False, then ConvertedText value set as SourceText.
Used with EntityCircularText, EntityImageText, EntityDataMatrix, EntityQRCode, EntityPDF417 entities.
Used with EntityText, EntitySiriusText also if CharacterSetFormats.Normal has configured.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.ITextConvertible.ConvertedText
member.remarks:
If IsConvertedText is True, event Config.OnTextConvert will be fired and modified ConvertedText as returned value when do IMarkerable.Mark.
Used with EntityCircularText, EntityImageText, EntityDataMatrix, EntityQRCode, EntityPDF417 entities.
Used with EntityText, EntitySiriusText also if CharacterSetFormats.Normal has configured.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.ITextRegisterable
member.remarks:
Register(or download) character set into RTC buffer.
Text data (like as EntitySiriusText) can be register (or download) into IRtcCharacterSet.
Do re-register(or download) again whenever text parameters like as font, size, rotate, and scale has modified.
Used with RTC5, RTC6 only.
Recommended to use with IRtcMoF by external /START trigger.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.ITextRegisterable.Register(SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Marker.IMarker,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.CharacterSets)
member.summary: Register(or download) text characterset into RTC
member.remarks:
If ITextRegisterable entity has regened(or modified), it should do re-registered.
Used with IRtcCharacterSet.
Used with EntityCharacterSetText, EntitySiriusCharacterSetText entities.
Used with RTC5, RTC6 only.
Characterset buffer at RTC would be overwritten.

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.ICalibration3D
member.remarks:
Do 3D scanner field correction by SCANLAB's calibration tool.
Used with EntityPlane, EntityCone, EntityPointsCloud entities.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.ICalibration3D.Calibration3D(SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc,System.String@,System.String@,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.slcl_error_codes@)
member.remarks:
Input correction file: Used source correction file at Rtc.CorrectionFiles[0].FileName.
Output correction file: If calibration had succeeded, converted correction table has load and selected by automatically at last table location.
member.param: Created new correction filename if succeeded

member.name: T:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.EntityPlane
member.remarks:
Recalculates a 3D-Correction table for a new user-defined target plane that may be shifted, tilted, and rotated.
The new target plane must be provided in parameter form with a reference point and two direction vectors.
Depending on how much shifted and tilted the new target plane is compared to the original target plane, the Correction file may not be useful anymore for 3d-points that are not in the target plane.
This cannot be remedied through further 3d-correction.

member.name: P:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.EntityPlane.Reference
member.summary: The reference point represents the new origin of the target plane, while the direction vectors represent the new X- and Y- directions in the target plane.

member.name: M:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Entity.EntityPointsCloud.ActPointsCloudCalibration(OpenTK.Vector3[],SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.IRtc,System.String@,System.String@,SpiralLab.Sirius2.Scanner.Rtc.slcl_error_codes@)
member.summary: Convert 3D scanner field correction by array of vertices.
member.remarks:
Input correction file : Used source correction file at Rtc.CorrectionFiles[0].FileName.
Output correction file : If calibration had succeeded, correction table has load and selected by automatically at last table(TABLE4 or TABLE8) location.
The target surface must be provided as a a series of points in 3d space.
The function will interpolate between these points and adjust the Correction table so that the laser spot is always in focus on the given surface.
The user later needs to only command 2d positions to the RTC and the focal shift is automatically adjusted.
The coordinate system after the correction uses top view projection, meaning that X and Y are exactly the same as before.
member.param: Created new correction filename if succeeded

User can register event handler for open sirius file.
Event will be fired when user has click 'Open' menu at SiriusEditorUserControl.
If user event handler is not attached, default routine has executed.
If returned 'False', default routine would be executed.

member.name: E:SpiralLab.Sirius2.Winforms.Config.OnTextConvert
member.remarks:
User can register event handler to convert data of ITextConvertible.
Event will be fired when ITextConvertable.IsConvertText is True only.
Event will be fired whenever do IMarkerable.Mark or IEntity.Regen.
If user event handler is not attached, used SourceText value.
IMarker value can be NULL while IEntity.Regen.
IMarker.CurrentOffsetIndex values are useful when marks at multiple offset positions.
IMarker can be MarkerVirtual if do simulate laser path.
Consider as its working within async threads.

member.remarks:
It works with ITextConvertable.IsConvertText is True only.
Try to convert every do IMarkerable.Mark.
member.param: IMarker (Can be MarkerVirtual if do simulate laser path)
member.returns: Converted text data (if failed, SourceText has returned)

member.summary:
Event for ICalibration3D has done (or success to convert)

Config.OnCalibration3D is for create new 3D correction file (with new z depth table).

User can register event handler for ICalibration3D has succeeded.
Event will be fired when success to convert new scanner 3D field correction file by ICalibration3D.
Both(Primary and secondary head) target correction table are Table4 if RTC5.
Both(Primary and secondary head) target correction table are Table8 if RTC6.

remarks.para: Note: The Chart class came from the AForge.NET Framework, from a time when better charting solutions were not really available for the .NET Framework. This class is mainly intended to support applications that had already been written using AForge.NET and that would benefit from porting over to Accord.NET.
At this time, if you need support for advanced charts in your application, it is recommended to use a more complete charting solution for .NET such as ZedGraph or Microsoft's own charting controls.
The value sets the X range of data to be displayed on the chart.

member.summary: Add data series to the chart.
member.param: Width (depends on the data series type, see remarks).

remarks.para: Adds new empty data series to the collection of data series. To update this series the method should be used.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.AddDataSeries(System.String,System.Drawing.Color,Accord.Controls.Chart.SeriesType,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add data series to the chart.
member.param: Width (depends on the data series type, see remarks).

remarks.para: Adds new empty data series to the collection of data series.

The updateYRange parameter specifies if the data series may affect displayable Y range. If the value is set to false, then displayable Y range is not updated, but used the range, which was specified by user (see property). In the case if the value is set to true, the displayable Y range is recalculated to fully fit the new data series.
